Sales_Trend_Insight.insight_details: Analyze monthly sales trends using DATE_TRUNC('month', OrderDate). Utilize seasonal decomposition for identifying patterns.

relation_columns.OrderDate: Date column indicating when the order was placed. Critical for time series analysis and demand forecasting.

relation_columns.SalesAmount: Numeric column (USD) showing the total sales amount. Essential for revenue tracking and financial reporting.

relations.TimeTrend_Sales: Analyze monthly sales trends using DATE_TRUNC('month', OrderDate). Utilize seasonal decomposition for identifying patterns.

sql_results_pair.sql_query: SELECT DATE(OrderDate) AS month, SUM(SalesAmount) AS total_sales FROM data GROUP BY month ORDER BY month LIMIT 5

AdSpend_Trend_Insight.insight_details: Analyze trends in advertisement spending over time using DATE_TRUNC('month', OrderDate). Useful for aligning spend with sales cycles.

relation_columns.OrderDate: Date column indicating when the order was placed. Critical for time series analysis and demand forecasting.

relation_columns.AdSpend: Numeric column (USD) detailing the expenditure on advertising. Crucial for marketing budget allocation and efficiency evaluation.

relations.TimeTrend_AdSpend: Analyze trends in advertisement spending over time using DATE_TRUNC('month', OrderDate). Useful for aligning spend with sales cycles.

sql_results_pair.sql_query: SELECT strftime('%Y-%m', OrderDate) AS month, SUM(AdSpend) AS total_ad_spend FROM data GROUP BY month ORDER BY month LIMIT 5

AdSpend_Profit_Correlation_Insight.insight_details: Investigate if higher ad spend correlates with higher profits. Consider lagging ad spend by one period.

relation_columns.AdSpend: Numeric column (USD) detailing the expenditure on advertising. Crucial for marketing budget allocation and efficiency evaluation.

relation_columns.Profit: Numeric column (USD) calculating the profit earned. Critical for understanding business performance and sustainability.

relations.Correlation_AdSpend_Profit: Perform Pearson correlation to see if higher ad spend correlates with higher profits. Consider lagging ad spend by one period.

sql_results_pair.sql_query: SELECT AdSpend, Profit FROM data LIMIT 5
WITH LaggedAdSpend AS (SELECT AdSpend, LAG(AdSpend, 1) OVER (ORDER BY ROWID) AS Lagged_AdSpend, Profit FROM data) SELECT Lagged_AdSpend, Profit FROM LaggedAdSpend LIMIT 5

AdSpend_Sales_Correlation_Insight.insight_details: Analyze the relationship between advertisement expenditure and sales volume. Look into both concurrent and lead-lag effects.

relation_columns.AdSpend: Numeric column (USD) detailing the expenditure on advertising. Crucial for marketing budget allocation and efficiency evaluation.

relation_columns.SalesAmount: Numeric column (USD) showing the total sales amount. Essential for revenue tracking and financial reporting.

relations.Correlation_AdSpend_SalesAmount: Analyze the relationship between advertisement expenditure and sales volume. Look into both concurrent and lead-lag effects.

sql_results_pair.sql_query: SELECT AdSpend, SalesAmount FROM data LIMIT 5
SELECT lag.AdSpend AS Prev_AdSpend, curr.SalesAmount FROM data curr LEFT JOIN data lag ON curr.ROWID = lag.ROWID + 1 LIMIT 5
SELECT lead.AdSpend AS Next_AdSpend, curr.SalesAmount FROM data curr LEFT JOIN data lead ON curr.ROWID = lead.ROWID - 1 LIMIT 5

Profit_Derivation_Insight.insight_details: Check if sales amount and cost directly derive profit: Profit = SalesAmount - Cost.

relation_columns.SalesAmount: Numeric column (USD) showing the total sales amount. Essential for revenue tracking and financial reporting.

relation_columns.Cost: Numeric column (USD) representing the cost of goods sold. Fundamental for margin calculation and profitability analysis.

relation_columns.Profit: Numeric column (USD) calculating the profit earned. Critical for understanding business performance and sustainability.

relations.Redundancy_Check_Profit: Check if sales amount and cost directly derive profit: Profit = SalesAmount - Cost.

sql_results_pair.sql_query: SELECT *, SalesAmount - Cost AS calculated_profit FROM data WHERE Profit != SalesAmount - Cost LIMIT 5

Regional_Sales_Cluster_Insight.insight_details: Group sales data by region to compare sales performance across different geographies.

relation_columns.Region: Categorical column indicating geographic region of sales. Useful for regional performance analysis and strategy development.

relation_columns.SalesAmount: Numeric column (USD) showing the total sales amount. Essential for revenue tracking and financial reporting.

relations.Cluster_Region_Sales: Group sales data by region using GROUP BY to compare sales performance across different geographies.

sql_results_pair.sql_query: SELECT Region, SUM(SalesAmount) AS total_sales FROM data GROUP BY Region LIMIT 5

CustomerSegment_ProfitMargin_Insight.insight_details: Analyze how profit margin varies across customer segments. Useful for identifying high-value segments.

relation_columns.CustomerSegment: Categorical column specifying customer segment type, such as 'New'. Important for targeting and campaign optimization.

relation_columns.ProfitMargin: Numeric column denoting the profit margin as a percentage. Important for evaluating business efficiency and competitive positioning.

relations.Cluster_CustomerSegment_ProfitMargin: Analyze how profit margin varies across customer segments. Useful for identifying high-value segments.

sql_results_pair.sql_query: SELECT CustomerSegment, AVG(ProfitMargin) AS average_profit_margin FROM data GROUP BY CustomerSegment ORDER BY average_profit_margin DESC LIMIT 5

AdChannel_MarketingROI_Insight.insight_details: Compare ROI across different advertising channels. Key for channel strategy optimization.

relation_columns.AdChannel: Categorical column indicating the advertising channel used, e.g., 'Display Ads'. Relevant for assessing channel performance and ROI analysis.

relation_columns.MarketingROI: Numeric column illustrating marketing return on investment. Essential for assessing the effectiveness of marketing expenditures.

relations.Cluster_AdChannel_MarketingROI: Compare ROI across different advertising channels using GROUP BY. Key for channel strategy optimization.

sql_results_pair.sql_query: SELECT AdChannel, AVG(MarketingROI) AS average_roi FROM data GROUP BY AdChannel LIMIT 5
SELECT AdChannel, MarketingROI FROM data ORDER BY MarketingROI DESC LIMIT 5
